message.content: {"steps":[{"output":"f(x) = 2x^3 - 9x + ax + 5","explanation":"The given function is \\( f(x) = 2x^3 - 9x + ax + 5 \\)."},{"output":"f'(x) = 6x^2 - 9 + a","explanation":"To find the critical points, we first find the derivative of \\( f(x) \\). The derivative is \\( f'(x) = 6x^2 - 9 + a \\)."},{"output":"f'(1) = 6(1)^2 - 9 + a = 0","explanation":"Since there is a local maximum at \\( x = 1 \\), we set \\( f'(1) = 0 \\). This gives us the equation \\( 6(1)^2 - 9 + a = 0 \\)."},{"output":"6 - 9 + a = 0 \\Rightarrow a = 3","explanation":"Solving \\( 6 - 9 + a = 0 \\) gives \\( a = 3 \\)."},{"output":"f'(x) = 6x^2 - 9 + 3 = 6x^2 - 6","explanation":"Substituting \\( a = 3 \\) into \\( f'(x) \\), we get \\( f'(x) = 6x^2 - 6 \\)."},{"output":"f'(x) = 6(x^2 - 1) = 6(x - 1)(x + 1)","explanation":"Factoring \\( 6x^2 - 6 \\) gives \\( 6(x^2 - 1) = 6(x - 1)(x + 1) \\)."},{"output":"x = 1 \\text{ or } x = -1","explanation":"Setting \\( f'(x) = 0 \\) gives the critical points \\( x = 1 \\) and \\( x = -1 \\)."},{"output":"b = -1","explanation":"Since \\( x = 1 \\) is a local maximum, \\( x = -1 \\) must be the local minimum, so \\( b = -1 \\)."},{"output":"a + b = 3 + (-1) = 2","explanation":"Finally, we calculate \\( a + b = 3 + (-1) = 2 \\)."}],"final_answer":"\\boxed{2}"}
